title: Zak Hardaker: I'm more clued up now than in 2017 and the three-day drinking session post-England match
text:
Zak Hardaker drank for three days solid after his last rugby league international appearance, but he insists there will be no repeat following his shock Great Britain call-up.

The Wigan Warriors full-back was a surprise inclusion in Wayne Bennett's 24-man squad for their forthcoming tour of New Zealand and Papua New Guinea. Hardaker's talent on the field is undeniable but off it he has racked up a lengthy charge sheet which includes a 14-month ban after testing positive for cocaine and being caught drink driving last year.

That prompted the 27-year-old to enter the Sporting Chance clinic and he claims to have changed his ways since his last England cap against Samoa in Australia in May 2017. Hardaker said: “In 2017, I finished the game and I think I drank for three days solid afterwards.

“It wasn’t just me, there were about 13 other lads. We went straight through drinking – drinking on the plane and then drinking when we got home.

“We started in Sydney and finished in Manchester. I went straight through – drinking in Sydney, drinking to the airport, free drinks in the airport and then on the 24-hour flight back home.
description: Zak Hardaker drank for three days solid after his last rugby league international appearance, but he insists there will be no repeat following his shock Great Britain call-up.
